content:
Certainly! Here are the five class diagrams you requested:

1. Super Class "User" and Subclasses "Student", "Professor", and "Administrator"
```sql
       +-------------+
       |    User     |
       +-------------+
               ^
               |
+--------------+--------------+
|              |              |
|         +--------+     +-----------+
|         |Student |     |  Professor|
|         +--------+     +-----------+
|                               ^
|                               |
|                           +---------+
|                           |Admin    |
|                           +---------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Class Schedule"
```lua
       +----------------+
       |  ClassSchedule |
       +----------------+
       |                |
       |+---------------+
       ||- start_time   |
       ||- end_time     |
       ||- day_of_week  |
       ||- location     |
       ||- course_code  |
       ||- course_name  |
       |+---------------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Board"
```lua
       +---------+
       |   Board |
       +---------+
       |         |
       |+--------+
       ||- title |
       ||- body  |
       ||- date  |
       ||- type  |
       |+--------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Student"
```lua
       +---------+
       | Student |
       +---------+
       |         |
       |+--------+
       ||- name  |
       ||- id    |
       ||- major |
       |+--------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Professor"
```lua
       +-----------+
       | Professor |
       +-----------+
       |           |
       |+----------+
       ||- name    |
       ||- id      |
       ||- subject |
       |+----------+
```
Note: These diagrams are just one possible representation of the Everytime application and its components, and there are other ways to model the system depending on the specific requirements and use cases.
